drupalNodeEvent.title: The State Never Retreats: State Enterprises in the Chinese Economy, 1995-2018

field_speakers.processed: Mr. Andrew Batson, China Research Director, Gavekal Dragonomics, Beijing

field_organizers.processed: China Studies Program, The Henry M. Jackson School of International Studies, University of Washington

field_description.processed: Even after forty years of market reforms, the question of what role the state and private sectors play in China's socialist market economy is still unsettled. Is the country experiencing a steady expansion of private businesses, or a new advance of state enterprises? In this talk, Andrew Batson will introduce new estimates of the economic size and structure of China's state-owned enterprise sector, which turn out to have been remarkably stable over the past quarter century. He will discuss what these research findings show about the nature of China's political system, how they affect our understanding of the history of China's reform era, and what they mean for the future trajectory of China's economy.
